A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The worlds longest space chase. This movie is what happens when you fail to map out the direction you're going to take with a trilogy. If you remove Luke committing force suicide (or w/e the eff that was)  this movie would feel more like a fan film of what could have happened between episode VII and VIII. Instead we get this trash pile that doesn't really serve to advance the trilogy's story line.  Which furthermore paints the direction of the trilogy into a rushed corner for Episode IX.
